questionText: Who said: 'Only the dead have seen the end of war'?
explanation: This quote is attributed to Plato.

questionText: Who is credited with: 'The pen is mightier than the sword'?
explanation: Edward Bulwer-Lytton coined this phrase.

questionText: Who said: 'Insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results'?
explanation: Albert Einstein is commonly credited with this quote.

questionText: Who said: 'Mathematics is the queen of sciences'?
explanation: Carl Gauss referred to mathematics as the queen of sciences.

questionText: Who stated: 'A doctor is someone who gets paid for talking while nature cures the disease'?
explanation: Voltaire is known for this humorous remark.

questionText: Who said: 'History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce'?
explanation: Karl Marx is credited with this statement.

questionText: Who famously said: 'I think, therefore I am'?
explanation: René Descartes formulated this philosophical statement.

questionText: Who said: 'Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change'?
explanation: Stephen Hawking stated this.

questionText: Who wrote: 'God is dead'?
explanation: Friedrich Nietzsche famously proclaimed this.

questionText: Who said: 'An unexamined life is not worth living'?
explanation: Socrates made this statement.

questionText: Who said: 'Time is money'?
explanation: Benjamin Franklin is known for popularizing this phrase.

questionText: Who is credited with: 'Give me liberty, or give me death'?
explanation: Patrick Henry made this declaration.

questionText: Who wrote: 'We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal'?
explanation: Thomas Jefferson wrote these words in the Declaration of Independence.

questionText: Who said: 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself'?
explanation: This quote comes from Franklin D. Roosevelt's inaugural address.

questionText: Who famously said: 'I have a dream'?
explanation: Martin Luther King Jr. delivered this iconic speech.

questionText: Who is known for the phrase: 'Speak softly and carry a big stick'?
explanation: Theodore Roosevelt popularized this saying.

questionText: Who wrote: 'Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe'?
explanation: This quote is often attributed to Abraham Lincoln.

questionText: Who said: 'An investment in knowledge pays the best interest'?
explanation: Benjamin Franklin is credited with this quote.

questionText: Who stated: 'Do what you can, with what you have, where you are'?
explanation: This quote is attributed to Theodore Roosevelt.

questionText: Who said: 'Happiness depends upon ourselves'?
explanation: Aristotle is credited with this statement.

questionText: Who wrote: 'Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans'?
explanation: John Lennon wrote this in his song 'Beautiful Boy.'

questionText: Who said: 'I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work'?
explanation: Thomas Edison famously said this about his many attempts to create a successful light bulb.

questionText: Who is credited with: 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts'?
explanation: Winston Churchill made this observation.

questionText: Who said: 'To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance'?
explanation: Oscar Wilde is known for this witty remark.

questionText: Who stated: 'Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail'?
explanation: This quote is attributed to Ralph Waldo Emerson.

questionText: Who said: 'What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals'?
explanation: This quote is commonly attributed to Zig Ziglar.

questionText: Who is credited with: 'Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere'?
explanation: Martin Luther King Jr. wrote this in his 'Letter from Birmingham Jail.'

questionText: Who said: 'Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced'?
explanation: James Baldwin is credited with this statement.

questionText: Who stated: 'Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world'?
explanation: Nelson Mandela made this famous observation.

questionText: Who said: 'A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step'?
explanation: Lao Tzu is credited with this ancient proverb.

questionText: Who wrote: 'The best way to predict the future is to create it'?
explanation: Peter Drucker is known for this forward-thinking quote.

questionText: Who said: 'Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated'?
explanation: Confucius made this observation about life.

questionText: Who is credited with: 'In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity'?
explanation: Albert Einstein is often attributed with this quote.

questionText: Who said: 'Peace begins with a smile'?
explanation: Mother Teresa is known for this simple yet profound statement.

questionText: Who wrote: 'We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit'?
explanation: Aristotle made this observation about human nature.

questionText: Who said: 'An eye for an eye will leave the whole world blind'?
explanation: Mahatma Gandhi is often credited with this saying.

questionText: Who stated: 'To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment'?
explanation: Ralph Waldo Emerson is credited with this thought-provoking quote.

questionText: Who said: 'Do unto others as you would have them do unto you'?
explanation: This is known as the Golden Rule, often attributed to Jesus Christ.

questionText: Who is known for the phrase: 'All men are created equal'?
explanation: Thomas Jefferson wrote these words in the Declaration of Independence.

questionText: Who stated: 'The best revenge is massive success'?
explanation: Frank Sinatra is credited with this quote.

questionText: Who said: 'If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything'?
explanation: Mark Twain made this famous statement.

questionText: Who wrote: 'Without music, life would be a mistake'?
explanation: Friedrich Nietzsche made this observation.

questionText: Who stated: 'Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right''?
explanation: Napoleon Hill is known for this motivational statement.

questionText: Who said: 'Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear—not absence of fear'?
explanation: Mark Twain is often credited with this quote about courage.

questionText: Who said: 'The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong'?
explanation: Mahatma Gandhi is credited with this profound statement.

questionText: Who is credited with: 'Not all those who wander are lost'?
explanation: J.R.R. Tolkien wrote this in 'The Lord of the Rings.'

questionText: Who said: 'Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it'?
explanation: This quote is often attributed to Henry David Thoreau.

questionText: Who wrote: 'Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened'?
explanation: Dr. Seuss is credited with this cheerful remark.

questionText: Who said: 'It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both'?
explanation: This comes from Machiavelli's 'The Prince.'

questionText: Who stated: 'A room without books is like a body without a soul'?
explanation: Cicero made this timeless observation.

questionText: Who said: 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts'?
explanation: Winston Churchill is credited with this statement.

questionText: Who stated: 'Time is the wisest counselor of all'?
explanation: This is attributed to the ancient Greek statesman Pericles.

questionText: Who wrote: 'The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step'?
explanation: Lao Tzu is credited with this ancient proverb.

questionText: Who said: 'If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together'?
explanation: This is an African proverb emphasizing teamwork.

questionText: Who said: 'I never teach my pupils, I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn'?
explanation: Einstein is credited with this teaching philosophy.

questionText: Who wrote: 'The unexamined life is not worth living'?
explanation: This is attributed to Socrates.

questionText: Who stated: 'It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop'?
explanation: Confucius is credited with this observation.
